name: The Boy
description: A 2.5D puzzle adventure game using water physics
details: Implemented object interactions using the character's jump and abilities
Simulated large object movements using Distance Joint 2D, vectors, and sleep
Stored checkpoints and puzzle progress using SQLite
Saved in-game data with PlayerPrefs
Implemented water effects using Buoyancy Effect 2D
outcomes: Successfully published the project on the Google Play Store, demonstrating its distribution potential
Received positive feedback from fellow students and professors at the educational institution, recognizing its quality and completion

name: Shroud
description: A first-person 3D stealth game where players use three different monsters' abilities to escape
details: Developed enemy AI using Unity's navigation system
Added AI for three unique enemies and implemented interactions through method calls
Designed adjustable camera effects using animation curves
Integrated Wwise SDK for immersive sound and streamlined collaboration with sound designers
Optimized particle effects using Popcorn FX
outcomes: Received positive feedback from gaming industry professionals immediately after presenting the graduation project
Gained favorable responses from students and faculty, earning recognition for the project's quality and completion

name: Iron Shadow
description: A 2D platformer set in a cyberpunk future where the protagonist uses four different weapons to stop machines threatening the world
details: Implemented gravity bullets using real-time layer changes with Vector3.Lerp
Designed enemies that approach the player for melee attacks and shoot from a distance
Developed over five interactive objects that respond to ice, electricity, and gravity guns
Created a boss that changes attack patterns across three phases
outcomes: Won the 'Best 2D Game' award at a campus-hosted event, officially proving the artistic value of the work

name: AR Soccer
description: A 2D multiplayer soccer game where players select a character and play 1v1 matches
details: Synchronized character movements using Photon
Implemented character switching for both players
Randomized background music upon completion of a track
Developed controls for 1v1 soccer gameplay

name: AR Subway
description: A 2D shooting game where players use GPS to travel between subway stations and defend against zombie attacks
details: Developed shooting, reloading, and weapon-switching mechanics with sound effects
Used LBS to generate station-specific defenses based on GPS coordinates
Implemented automatic enemy spawning and adjusted enemy count based on station data

name: VR GMMiner
description: A VR job simulation game where the player becomes a miner, drills rocks with a jackhammer, plants dynamite, and proceeds by detonating it.
details: Developed the overall gameplay
Adjusted jackhammer operation and dynamite detonation to fit VR interaction using both hands
Optimized the game for VR devices
outcomes: Installed VR experience content at Gwangmyeong Cave, providing visitors with a new immersive experience
Contributed to extending visitor stay and enhancing satisfaction through VR experiences
Established as a unique regional tourism attraction by utilizing VR technology
Maximized the appeal of the content by visually promoting the vivid VR experience

name: VR Attraction Engineer
description: A VR job simulation game where the player becomes a maintenance engineer for Everland's T-Express roller coaster, identifying and fixing track issues.
details: Served as the lead programmer, managing the overall development
Developed tools for players to use during gameplay
Conducted R&D and integration with Samsung Odyssey
Developed the final drop section and effects such as tool animations
Optimized the game for VR devices
outcomes: Operated a VR job experience program for students at a Korean amusement park, providing educational content
Simulated potentially dangerous real-life scenarios in a virtual environment to effectively deliver safety education

name: Snow Pang
description: A game designed for children where players use a sensor attached to a wall to throw balls at approaching monsters and save their village.
details: Developed sensor integration and hit detection mechanics
Created and managed monster generation and processing
Designed and implemented scene transition UI and general UI elements
outcomes: Provided immersive content for children at the festival, achieving high participation and satisfaction rates
Vividly recreated igloos and a winter theme, offering a safe and enjoyable experience for kids
Received widespread praise from visitors and festival organizers for its creative and educational content

name: Nori Pang
description: A children's game where players throw balls at bubbles on a wall to rescue characters using wall-mounted sensors.
details: Sensor integration and hit detection development
Development of monster generation and handling
UI development, including scene transitions and general UI design
outcomes: Provided immersive content for children at the festival, achieving high participation and satisfaction rates
Received widespread praise from visitors and festival organizers for its creative and educational content

name: Music VR
description: An immersive VR music performance where players sing to virtual avatars cheering for them in a concert hall.
details: Effect optimization
System implementation using HTC Vive
Background changes in sync with the music
Interactive system using a microphone to encourage avatar cheers

name: VR Jungle Adventure
description: A visual experience where players ride a minecart along a designated track and explore the scenery.
details: Modifications to rail assets for functionality
Animation control and tool development for specific actions
outcomes: Showcased innovative and immersive VR content at VR Park Tokyo and VR Expo Japan
Earned significant recognition for the quality and creativity of the content from participants and organizers

name: VR Horror Chair
description: A visual content experience in a haunted mansion, allowing players to explore various horror scenarios.
details: Development for elevator movement
Animation control and tool development for specific actions
outcomes: Showcased innovative and immersive VR content at VR Park Tokyo and VR Expo Japan
Earned significant recognition for the quality and creativity of the content from participants and organizers

name: Forest Garden
description: A system where photos are sent, applied to animals, and displayed alongside their animations.
details: Development for loading and applying photos from folders onto animals
Animal animation application and adjustments

name: Aloha Heroes
description: An FPS defense game where 1-4 players team up to defeat enemies and protect the Aloha Peace Hall.
details: Development of enemy AI movements
Boss patterns and animation implementation
Multiplayer integration using Photon
Stage transition implementation
outcomes: Achieved high participation rates by installing at the Aloha Peace Pavilion

name: KEIT Electronic System Development Project
description: A two-content system allowing users to pick up objects in a VR world using tactile gloves and experience autonomous driving in a car.
details: Adaptation of external glove protocols for Unity3D compatibility
Implementation of steering wheel controls for spline-based vehicle movement
outcomes: Successfully accomplished a national project through collaboration with external companies

name: Game Industry Advancement Support Project
description: Enhancements to an existing game system.
details: Localization (translation and voice recording) and application of an existing game system
Data table creation for English and Korean subtitles and dubbing
Fixing bugs and issues in the existing game system
outcomes: Resolved 90% of major bugs and improved user accessibility through localization, leading to an increase in global players
Integrated English/Korean subtitles and dubbing data, improving maintenance efficiency by approximately 30%

name: Startup Leap Package Support Project
description: Adapting over three existing VR games for kids into an all-in-one VR platform to expand content scalability.
details: Adaptation and implementation of over three existing kids' VR games into the all-in-one VR platform
Adjustment of control schemes for compatibility with the new platform
Version control to maintain up-to-date content through downloads and uploads
Implementation of ad playback when games are not in use
outcomes: Secured content stability by resolving over 90% of major bugs and significantly enhanced content management efficiency within stores through platformization
Successfully executed a collaborative project with other companies using new Meta Quest 2 devices, strengthening VR device compatibility

name: Yangju Sports Welfare Center Dinosaur Ball Throwing Game
description: A game where players use sensors on a wall to throw balls at dinosaurs, part of a larger content collection for the Yangju Sports Welfare Center.
details: Development of the overall game system
Dinosaur AI and animation looping
Implementation of systems to add variety across stages
outcomes: Established as an interactive experience content at the Yangju Sports Welfare Center, allowing children to interact with and enjoy dinosaurs
Provided an educational and entertaining user experience through AI-driven dinosaur interactions and laser sensor-based interactive content
Enhanced visitor satisfaction at the welfare center with sensor-based experiential content, contributing to local community activities

name: Yangju Sports Welfare Center Punch Pang VR
description: A VR experience with over three types of content for the Yangju Sports Welfare Center.
details: Base system work for the Punch Pang content
outcomes: Positioned as an interactive experience content at the Yangju Sports Welfare Center, encouraging children to exercise and interact while having fun

name: Sunchang Fermentation Science AR Gun & Video System Development
description: An AR-based project where players capture flying microorganisms and use them to terraform Mars.
details: Development of a system where microorganisms float around using the mobile camera
Implementation of a Bluetooth-enabled gun system for shooting microorganisms
Sending captured microorganisms to a networked PC with projectors for synchronized effects and animations
Video editing and synchronization across multiple PCs for consistent playback
outcomes: Installed at the Sunchang Food Science Center, providing children with engaging content that sparks interest in terraforming and microbial ecosystems while experiencing scientific concepts
Delivered synchronized content across multiple displays with stable performance through a sensor-based interactive system and network integration
Built an interactive system where player actions are reflected in real time, significantly improving visitor immersion and satisfaction
Became the center's flagship experiential content, contributing to the activation of science education and experiences in the local community

name: Suit Fitting Simulation
description: A solution project for measuring body size virtually on mobile and PC to provide custom suit fitting services.
details: Implementation of UI/UX tailored to the system
Development of interactive UI integration
Ensuring compatibility across mobile and PC resolutions
outcomes: Improved the existing UI system to provide an optimized environment where operators can efficiently manage and apply UI elements
Enhanced system stability and user convenience by ensuring UI compatibility across various resolutions and platforms
Increased accessibility and usability of content through user experience-focused UI/UX improvements

name: Gyeonggi Student Sports Center Experience System
description: A project offering over six types of exercise content to transform the monotonous traditional physical education system into a game-like, enjoyable activity.
details: Development of UI and base systems for over six types of exercise content
Implementation of consistent and easy-to-maintain gameplay mechanics for all exercise types
outcomes: Developed user-centered content to make diverse sports content more enjoyable and accessible for students
Built an environment that simplifies maintenance and allows for easy expansion of additional content through a unified system structure
Increased the immersion of sports content and enhanced user engagement, boosting the efficiency of education and exercise

name: Fire Equipment VR Training Content Production
description: A VR training project using Meta Quest to simulate fire equipment installation, including pressure calculations and electrical setups for building safety.
details: Development of a complete operational system and virtual wire connection simulation
Implementation of a results system to identify successful and failed operations
Pressure system calculations to verify proper equipment installation
outcomes: Provided experiential learning content that allows university students to simulate and learn complex fire equipment processes in a VR environment
Improved problem-solving skills and practical understanding of students through an equipment operation and installation verification system
Demonstrated a new direction for safety education content by leveraging virtual environments for practical training, proving tangible educational effectiveness
Enhanced learner satisfaction and engagement with intuitive interaction and real-time feedback systems

name: Metaverse Lecture Using VR Chat
description: A system utilizing VR Chat to host presentations and discussions for large groups.
details: Implementation of YouTube playback and external video streaming in VR Chat
Development of features allowing administrators to trigger events like fireworks in VR Chat
outcomes: Provided an environment supporting up to 40 simultaneous users, enabling them to present and share their projects in a metaverse lecture hall
Successfully hosted three diverse conference lectures, demonstrating the effectiveness of VR Chat-based lecture halls
Contributed to education and presentation activities by facilitating the use of VR-based lecture halls by both international and domestic organizations

name: The Truth
description: A 3D RPG game where players progress by defeating enemies.
details: Implemented character movements and attacks
Developed AI patterns for enemies and bosses
Created cinematic videos using Matinee

name: Super Pong VR
description: A 3D VR sports game where players compete with other players or AI to score goals in a map filled with obstacles using rackets.
details: Implemented HTC Vive gameplay
Developed feedback based on the speed of racket swings using Vive controllers and adjusted ball speed accordingly
Created AI movements to follow the ball
Implemented AI ball returns with rackets
Increased difficulty when AI goes out of bounds or is losing
Implemented time-attack mode with a set time limit
Developed scoring system to determine winners
Implemented set-based gameplay to determine overall victory
Added diverse obstacles that affect ball speed, direction, or trajectory
Synchronized ball speed
Synchronized racket movements between players
Added waiting effects until players connect
Developed travel system for server and client to move to the next map
outcomes: Successfully developed and installed competitive interactive content for visitors at Lotte World
Provided an engaging experience where visitors could compete with each other, becoming a new source of fun at the amusement park

name: Samdo Naval Headquarters Content
description: A VR game with six different mini-games set in the Samdo Naval Headquarters.
details: Managed and provided feedback on content developed by external vendors
Adjusted and modified specific content
Provided support for final installation and operations
outcomes: Successfully installed mini VR content integrated with six different simulators at Tongjeyeong
Positioned as content that allows users to experience the training and life of Admiral Yi Sun-sin during the Joseon Dynasty
As the project manager, improved content quality while meeting deadlines
Completed the project successfully by maximizing efficiency through close communication with subcontractors

name: XR Showroom
description: A social XR showroom project for cultural product distribution, where users create their own stores, upload them, and allow consumers to try on clothes using avatars and purchase items.
details: Implemented a system allowing avatars to enter uploaded stores
Developed a system for trying on and purchasing clothes
Synchronized movements of other users within the store
Implemented chat functionality between users or with sellers in the store
Created a system for placing clothes in the store
Optimized and updated the existing system for placing items and clothes in stores
Updated UI systems to align with new designs and made changes easier by data-driven implementation
Ensured functionality on Android phones, tablets, and iPads
Optimized UI for various devices
outcomes: Built a metaverse fashion platform that supports up to 10 simultaneous users, allowing them to invite guests to their virtual stores and interact
Successfully completed a national project verifying the business potential of individual metaverse fashion ventures
Secured compatibility across various platforms (Android, iOS) and devices, supporting a wide user base
Provided an environment conducive to maintenance and additional feature development through optimized and data-driven UI design of the existing system

name: Mobile Vehicle Jamboree Camping Experience
description: A content experience for all ages using a mobile large vehicle, a projector, and laser sensors to find objects or items like campfire wood through touch interactions.
details: Developed a touch system to interact with objects using touch sensors
Implemented the overall game system
Supported ride content programs and implemented systems like Planar VR
Developed a system to toggle projects and content on and off using tablets
outcomes: Introduced an NDI-based four-sided display system in a mobile vehicle, delivering highly immersive content
Built a system that allows content to be experienced while traveling to schools and various locations, securing a wide user base
Combined touch sensor-based interaction with multi-display technology to offer a differentiated user experience
Enhanced the mobility and scalability of content, presenting new possibilities for educational and experiential content

name: Portable Shooting Game DMZ Underground
description: A multiplayer content experience using backpack PCs and VR, allowing players to walk in the real world while shooting enemies.
details: Developed a system to move characters in sync with users' footsteps using mobile backpacks
Implemented animal and human enemy AI
Created systems for shooting and reloading guns
Implemented event systems occurring within the map
Designed a data table for enemies and events to simplify balancing tests for planners
Developed a system to record and synchronize each player's scores
outcomes: Successfully installed VR FPS content at the Gyeryong Military Experience Center, providing immersive experiences for adult visitors
Built an interactive system that reflects players’ actions in real time, significantly enhancing visitor satisfaction
Established as the center’s flagship experiential content, contributing to expanding education and experiential opportunities in the local community

name: Land, Sea, and Air Force Simulation
description: A VR content experience allowing users to virtually operate an army tank, a navy submarine, and an air force fighter jet.
details: Developed plugins to integrate external 6-axis simulators with Unreal Engine and enable simulator operation
Improved existing systems for the air force and implemented enemy fighter jet appearances and targeting systems
Modified flight paths to enhance the realism of the flying experience
outcomes: Successfully installed VR simulator content at the Gyeryong Military Experience Center, offering immersive experiences for both adults and children
Improved visitor satisfaction significantly with an interactive system that reflects players’ actions in real time
Positioned as the center’s signature experiential content, contributing to the expansion of education and experiential opportunities in the local community

name: Road of Pilgrim
description: 2D Action Run Game
details: Used tile maps to designate the map, enemy, and player spawn locations
Dynamically generated enemies at designated spawn points using vector and sprite creation features
Implemented sound playback for various platforms using sound textures, macros, and preprocessors
Applied hit detection and knockback effects using Box2D's real-time changes to static and dynamic bodies with collision handling
Optimized game memory by managing creation and removal of Box2D objects and vectors
Configured masks to prevent enemies' attacks from hitting each other while allowing the player's attacks to neutralize enemy attacks
Used scheduling to dynamically generate and remove particles and bodies within the game

name: VRZONE Launcher
description: A launcher facilitating communication between the platform and individual PCs for tasks such as launching or closing games.
details: Implemented UDP communication with the platform
Relayed the status of each PC (VR headsets, controller battery information, etc.)
Developed routines for game execution and closure
Added functionality to play advertisement videos after game closure if available
outcomes: Improved system stability significantly by resolving 90% of major bugs
Increased store operation convenience by enabling the management of diverse content on a single platform
Enhanced monetization potential through automatic playback of advertisement videos

name: Electromyography
description: A sensor integration project using electromyography devices to assist with exercise.
details: Developed Bluetooth communication between the electromyography device and PC
Displayed electromyography EMS formulas graphically on PC
outcomes: Developed and successfully delivered a product for external companies
Designed to ensure ease of use for external companies, receiving high usability evaluations
Received positive feedback from external companies for its convenient usability

name: VR Delta Platform
description: A launcher and platform integration between Delta kiosks and PCs, including UI implementation.

outcomes: Improved system stability significantly by resolving 90% of major bugs
